entry.title: Calculation View Features of 2025 QRC2
entry.content:
Within the time frame of 2025 Q2, several new calculation view features have been released in SAP Business Application Studio when connected to SAP HANA Cloud database QRC2. Some of these features are highlighted below. You can find examples that illustrate the individual features here. An overview of features of other releases can be found here.

Extract view nodes into Separate Calculation Views

With the refactor option "Extract to New View" you can now easily move a node with its substructures into a new calculation view

and subsequently replace the node with the new calculation view:

This option is available in the context menu of nodes other than the Default and Semantics node:

Modularize the design of your views with this option to increase reuse and insights into the view logic.

Support of HALF_VECTOR

The vector type HALF_VECTOR is now available for calculated columns. It uses 16 bits (16-bit Floating Point) to represent numeric values.
 

 

In addition, the SQL function TO_HALF_VECTOR is now available for conversion
 
 

 

Use this vector type to reduce memory footprint if the reduced precision compared to Real Vector (32-bit floating-point) can be tolerated.
 

Automap Columns By Name Inside Table Function Nodes

When mapping columns in table function nodes a new button is available that maps columns based on their names.
 

  

 Columns of the table input parameter of the table function that have the same names as the input columns, and scalar input parameters with the same names as calculation view input parameters will be automatically mapped when pressing the button.
 
Simplify the definition of table function nodes with this automap option.
 

Copy Window Functions and Local Hierarchies between Calculation Views

Copy window functions and local hierarchies between calculation views
 
 
 

If dependencies, such as used columns are missing in the target node a warning is shown and the dependency removed. If the dependency is mandatory the element has to be manually adapted.

 

More easily reuse your modelling developments across calculation views with this feature.
 

Labels and Notes Support Line Breaks

Labels and notes support now line breaks:

 

Use line breaks to better structure your information

entry.title: New Projects | Early Insights | Real Influence - SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 2-2025
entry.content:

This cycle features 53 new projects, offering SAP customers and partners the opportunity to get early insights into product developments and actively collaborate with SAP teams to help shape the future of SAP solutions.

In a fast-changing business environment, being part of the conversation early can make a real difference. SAP Customer Engagement Initiative gives you the chance to work directly with SAP product managers and developers, offering your feedback on ideas, prototypes, and plans while they‚Äôre still in early stages.

To help you explore the available projects, we‚Äôve compiled a detailed list for your convenience. Check out the full list here or follow the links below to discover the exciting opportunities:

entry.title: Season 2 Recap SAP HANA Cloud Videocast: Get an introduction to top of mind topics
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop-shop for all episodes of the second season of the SAP HANA Cloud Videocast.

This season, we‚Äôve brought you eight episodes packed with insights, innovations, and expert discussions. Whether you‚Äôre just starting your journey with SAP HANA Cloud or looking to deepen your expertise, this blogpost will guide you through the recent season. Dive into it and stay informed in terms of SAP HANA Cloud.

E1: Native Multitenancy in SAP HANA Cloud

Video Link: Watch Now 

Discover the game-changing feature of native multitenancy in SAP HANA Cloud. SAP HANA Cloud expert Ruediger Karl and Product Manager Susen Poppe explore the concept, its benefits, and real-world use cases. Learn how this feature can revolutionize your architecture and how start leveraging its power today.

E2: SQL on Files in SAP HANA Cloud

Video Link: Watch Now 

Join our product expert Seungjoon Lee to uncover the potential of "SQL on Files" in SAP HANA Cloud. This feature enhances data management by enabling direct SQL queries on files in object storage, boosting flexibility and cost-efficiency. Find out how to use this innovation with SAP HANA Cloud and accelerate your analytical scenarios.

E3: Next Level Administration with SAP HANA Cloud's Gen AI Virtual Assistant

Video Link: Watch Now 

Step into the future of database administration with SAP HANA Cloud's new virtual assistant, powered by SAP Joule. Product expert Jos√© Ramos demonstrates how GenAI streamlines operational tasks, offers guided assistance, and provides quick status analysis. Explore how this enhancement boosts productivity and enhances user experience.

E4: Private IP Endpoint Support in SAP HANA Cloud

Video Link: Watch Now 

Join product expert Robert Waywell to discover how private IP endpoint support in SAP HANA Cloud reduces network exposure and ensures secure connections. Learn about integrating native hyperscaler services like AWS PrivateLink, GCP Private Service Connect, and Azure Private Link, and why this is crucial for your cloud strategy.

E5: SAP HANA Cloud‚Äôs Knowledge Graph Engine

Video Link: Watch Now 

Explore the power of the Knowledge Graph Engine in SAP HANA Cloud with product expert Shabana Samsudheen. Learn how it connects data with context and semantics, enabling smarter, faster decisions. Get insights into real-world use cases, such as navigating legal and tax regulations globally, and start your journey with hands-on exercises, blogs, and sessions.

E6: Modernize with SAP HANA Cloud

Video Link: Watch Now 

Discover the seamless path to migrating to SAP HANA Cloud with product expert Roman Belosludtsev. Learn about the cloud-native benefits, flexible consumption models, and future-proof technologies that SAP HANA Cloud offers. Explore tools and resources to get started and transform your database strategy today.

E7: Dipping into SAP HANA Cloud, data lake

Video Link: Watch Now 

Dive into the power of SAP HANA Cloud, data lake with product expert Jason Hinsperger. Learn why enterprises need a data lake and how SAP HANA Cloud simplifies its creation. With seamless integration and comprehensive capabilities, SAP HANA Cloud offers a unique experience for managing and leveraging data. Get inspired by real-world customer examples and start your data journey today.

E8: Cloud Meets On-Prem: Unlock Hybrid Scenarios with SAP HANA Cloud

Video Link: Watch Now: 

Join product expert Tae-Suk Son as he explores hybrid scenarios in SAP HANA Cloud. Discover how to extend on-prem applications, access innovative features like machine learning, and combine data from various sources. Explore use cases, including analytical workloads and clean core applications, and start your journey to the cloud today.

It's been an incredible season filled with innovation insights and practical tips and tricks. We hope these videos inspire and motivate you to start or continue leveraging the potential of SAP HANA Cloud for your use case.

Stay Connected, Stay Inspired!

Susen on behalf SAP HANA Cloud Videocast Team

 

PS: BIG THANK YOU to all speakers!

  • Bangkok ‚Äì SAP GenAI - https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam/getting-started-with-generative-ai-hub-on-sap-ai-core-bangkok-thailand/ev-p/14112276 
  • SAP CodeJam Roadshow 2025 - Latin America edition üáßüá∑üáµüá™üá≤üáΩüá®üá¥(July 25th - Aug 12th 2024): https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-blog-posts/sap-codejam-roadshow-2025-latin-america-edition-july-25th-aug-12th-2025/ba-p/14093930 

 

 CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 TechEd Registration Is Live 

1:16 CodeTalk with Matt Harding 

2:04 What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud 2025/Q2 SAP 

4:02 InnerSource Summit 2025 CfP open until 15 July 

4:48 Update from the US AI CodeJam Roadshow 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for June the 26th, 2025.  

[Rich & Thomas] Hey, everybody. SAP TechEd registration is live. That's right. So if you want to get registered early and get a discount, make sure you get out there for the early nerd. Early nerd. Early nerd discount and register today. What you can expect at TechEd this year, great things like the Community Clubhouse. We want to make it bigger and better than ever. We want to bring back that community feel that we had at TechEds of years past. We'll have hands-on sessions. We'll have lectures, community talks, strategy talks, all kinds of information for you guys to take home and use to make yourselves better as developers and architects. Yeah, and of course, if you can't make it to Berlin for the big in-person TechEd, selective sessions will be streamed online on the virtual platform as well. And we'll have TechEd on tour. We've already announced some of the locations and dates with more coming soon as well. So hopefully, no matter where you are in the world, we're going to bring you some form of TechEd this year. And we look forward to seeing all of you there.  

[Mamikee] Hi, everyone. We have a brand new SAP Code Talk. I had the pleasure of sitting down with SAP mentor Matt Harding, where we covered so much from his early days in audio engineering to diving deep into RAP, clean core and ABAP best practices. and also why musicians make great developers. Now, he shared how his creative mindset shapes his approach to architecture and development. We spoke a little bit about the evolving of SAP community and how events like CodeTalk and TechEd are keeping developers inspired and connected. And we went into so much more. Now, you can check out this CodeTalk on our SAP Developers YouTube channel, and the link to this episode will be in the description below. You don't want to miss it.  

[Witalij] As we reach the midpoint of 2025, the second release of SAP HANA Cloud for the year is now available. Here is a quick look at the key innovations relevant for developers and data scientists among you. In SAP HANA Cloud Central, the main administrative tool, the SQL console has been enhanced to improve usability and functionality. The messages and history tabs have been merged into a single, customizable tab.There is now also an option to automatically format SQL for SAP HANA database connections, helping streamlining the developer experience. This release also brings several important enhancements in the area of embedded machine learning and AI. First, expanded support for tabular AI functions, including vector data analysis with AutoML. Second, a new text embedding module version is now available supporting more languages and optimized for short text scenarios. Newly supported languages include Japanese, Italian, or Chinese. Additionally, the default token length has been increased to 512. And third, capabilities for experiment tracking and task scheduling have also been introduced. For more details, including the Jupyter notebook that demonstrates these features, see the blog post by product manager Christoph Morgan. Following the initial release of the Knowledge Graph engine in Q1, we are now expanding its functionality. The new validate query form allows users to validate RDF data against constraints defined using the shapes, containing language, or shackle. As always, we continue to invest in graphical view modeling in SAP HANA Cloud. This release introduces new features you can explore in the blog post by product manager Jan Zauke. Examples of these features are available in the GitHub repository as well. For a visual summary of the release highlights, check out a short video featuring product manager Thomas Hammer. Links are in the description.  

[DJ] the inner source summit 2025 is on the 13th of November this year it's a special 10th anniversary affair which will be held simultaneously in three locations spanning three global time zones in New York, Berlin and Yokohama if you want to participate specifically give a presentation then note that the call for presenters is open and closes on the 15th of July. All the presentations are to be around 20 minutes and given live. What are you waiting for? Head over to the CFP form and submit your proposal for a chance to speak at this great event.  

[Rich & Thomas] Hey folks, Rich Heilman and Thomas Jung here. Yeah, we're in the SAP Palo Alto offices this week, as part of our US AI CodeJam Roadshow. We were in New York on Monday. We're here in California on Wednesday. And Friday, I'll be in Houston, Texas with our coworker, Mamikee. And we're covering the AI Code Jam. That's right. That's not the only thing we've got going on. What other do we have coming up? We have more roadshows coming up, right? We have roadshows in India, in Southeast Asia. And then we have our Latin America Roadshow, which I will be a part of, as well as Antonio and Josh and me, Mr. Jung. Well, I'm only coming to Mexico, and then you guys are hitting all the other locations. Too many to remember this thing today. But as always, you can check the description below for all the links if any of those events sound interesting to you. So we'll see everybody on the road, won't we? See you there. All right.

entry.title: Code Connect 2025: UI5con, reCAP, HANA Tech Con
entry.content:
This blog post summarizes the most important information about Code Connect 2025. It will be updated with further information (e.g. Event App, links to recordings...).

Code Connect 2025 ‚Äì three days, three conferences, one streamlined journey

Join us for the second annual  Code Connect, where we're bringing together the hottest tech events in one convenient location. Be ready to connect, collaborate, and code away with a bustling community of like-minded developers. Jump on the Code Connect train and elevate your conference experience!

  • Find more information here: https://code-connect.dev/ 
  • Event App: link

UI5con

reCAP

Code Jams & Warmup (July 7th)

Are you passionate about front-end development and have experience with OpenUI5 applications? Then don‚Äôt miss out on our OpenUI5-focused CodeJam! Join Peter Muessig and Nico Sch√∂nteich as they dive into advanced OpenUI5 topics. You‚Äôll experience TypeScript, setting up a mono repository, OData V4 caveats, integrating 3rd-party packages, creating custom controls and libraries, and testing strategies.

Prefer back-end development? Our second CodeJam is tailored just for you! Led by DJ Adams, Daniel Schlachter, and Johannes Vogt, this session will explore the powerful SAP Application Programming Model (CAP). You‚Äôll learn to integrate external services, work with CDS for declaring and relating entities, and leverage the SAP Cloud SDK for connectivity and destinations. In addition, we‚Äôll also dive into new CAP features. Check the essential prerequisites before arriving at the event location.

Join the Official Unofficial Pre-Event for Code Connect 2025!

  • Right after the UI5- and CAP-CodeJams - starting from 05:00 PM on Monday, July 7
  • Location: Restaurant ACE at Golf Club at St. Leon Rot, just a short walk from ROT03
  • See more details here

  (July 8th)

Your journey to UI5 mastery begins at UI5con, the ultimate destination for developers of all levels.

Get ready to navigate through a network of knowledge, discover the latest UI5 innovations, and make new friendships along the way. With a map full of expert sessions and interactive workshops, you'll connect with the UI5 community and its creators, exchanging valuable insights and experiences. Are ready to dive into the UI5 universe? UI5con is your ticket to ride!

Learn more about UI5con

 (July 9th)

Join the awesome developer conference all about the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). The time of the year where our lively communities, customers, and partners meet the CAP Product Team and exchange best practices, technical concepts, current projects, ideas for the future, and way more.

Learn more about reCAP

 (July 10th)

Get Connected! If there is anything about SAP HANA you always wanted to know but never dared to ask - this is the place for you! Be part of the community of development experts, users and partners to exchange, ignite and delight.

Get Involved! If you want to speak up in your own session worthwhile to be shared with this great community. Looking forward to see you there soon!

Learn more about HANA Tech Con

entry.title: HANA ML Data Drift Detector
entry.content:
The release of HANA ML 2.23 includes a new function called: APL data drift detector. This drift detector helps you spot changes or deviations between a given dataset and a reference. Reference data could be a version in the past, or a particular segment of customers or employees, or an expected distribution (e.g. Benford). Use cases of data comparison are:

  • This year employee survey results versus last year results by country
  • Machine learning inference dataset versus training dataset
  • Male staff versus female staff
  • Payment amounts by legal entity versus the Benford‚Äôs law to find potential fraud

This feature from APL (Automated Predictive Library) is available for both Python and SQL.

The rest of this blog will walk you through a scenario with code snippets in Python as well as SQL that you can reuse and adapt to your own case.

We chose to work with Olympics athletes and results data. The dataset contains summer and winter games since 1896. We want to make a comparison over time.

First, we connect to the SAP HANA database using a Python notebook.

DB_Host='host'  
DB_Port='port_number'
DB_User='user_name'
DB_Password='user_password'

from hana_ml import dataframe as hd
conn = hd.ConnectionContext(address = DB_Host, port = DB_Port, 
                            user = DB_User, password = DB_Password, 
                            encrypt = 'true', sslValidateCertificate = 'false' )
conn.connection.isconnected()

The reference dataframe comprises the Olympic games before 1970 ‚Ä¶

sql_cmd =  """ 
select "Height", "Weight", "Age", "Medal", "Gender", "Season", "Country", "Sport" 
from "APL_SAMPLES"."OLYMPICS" 
where "Year" <= 1970  
order by "Id"
"""
hdf_ref= hd.DataFrame(conn, sql_cmd)
hdf_ref.head(5).collect()

 

 

 

 

‚Ä¶ and the comparison dataframe, after 1970:

sql_cmd =  """ 
select "Height", "Weight", "Age", "Medal", "Gender", "Season", "Country", "Sport"
from "APL_SAMPLES"."OLYMPICS" 
where "Year" > 1970 
order by "Id"
"""
hdf_new= hd.DataFrame(conn, sql_cmd)
hdf_new.head(5).collect()

 

 

 

 

The code to run the comparison is the following:

from hana_ml.algorithms.apl.drift_detector import DriftDetector
apl_model = DriftDetector()
results = apl_model.fit_detect(hdf_ref, hdf_new, build_report=True)
print(results.collect())

 

 

 

All the variables appearing here have a deviation indicator over 0.95. This threshold can be changed with the syntax below:

results = apl_model.fit_detect(hdf_ref, hdf_new, threshold=0.80)

Here is a report putting the two datasets side by side with their counts (aka weight) by category; the most changing categories (top 10 here) appear first:

df = apl_model.get_debrief_report('Deviation_CategoryFrequencies').head(10).deselect(['Oid','Category Order']).collect()
format_dict = {
    'Ref Weight': '{:,.0f}', 'New Weight': '{:,.0f}', 'Change': '{:,.0f}', 
    'Ref % Weight': '{:.1f}', 'New % Weight': '{:.1f}', '% Change': '{:.1f}', 'Abs % Change': '{:.1f}'
}
df.style.format(format_dict).hide(axis='index')

KxMissing is a special category created by APL when finding empty or null values. With far less missing values on athletes‚Äô height and weight, we see that data quality is getting better overtime.

More women are participating to the Olympic games after 1970. The male % change value mirrors the female % change value. The same remark applies to summer and winter seasons.

The following code brings the data drift results as charts:

apl_model.generate_notebook_iframe_report()
# apl_model.generate_html_report('drift_olympics')

After comparing athletes across all types of sports, let‚Äôs compare them by sport. For that we must provide the drift detector with two dataframes sorted by Sport:

## Reference Dataset
sql_cmd =  """ 
select "Height", "Weight", "Age", "Medal", "Gender", "Season", "Country", "Sport" 
from "APL_SAMPLES"."OLYMPICS" 
where "Year" <= 1970  
order by "Sport", "Id"
"""
hdf_ref= hd.DataFrame(conn, sql_cmd)
hdf_ref.head(5).collect()

 

 

 

 

## Dataset for comparison
sql_cmd =  """ 
select "Height", "Weight", "Age", "Medal", "Gender", "Season", "Country", "Sport" 
from "APL_SAMPLES"."OLYMPICS" 
where "Year" > 1970  
order by "Sport", "Id"
"""
hdf_new= hd.DataFrame(conn, sql_cmd)
hdf_new.head(5).collect()

 

 

 

 

You specify the segment for drift detection the same way as for segmented forecasting, regression or classification scenarios:

col_segment= 'Sport'    
from hana_ml.algorithms.apl.drift_detector import DriftDetector
apl_model = DriftDetector(segment_column_name= col_segment, max_tasks= 4)
results = apl_model.fit_detect(hdf_ref, hdf_new, threshold=0.95)
print(results.sort(["Segment","Variable"]).collect())

The deviating variables appear for each sport:

 

 

 

 

 

We check if there are segments with status ‚ÄòFailed‚Äô:

my_filter = "KEY in ('AplTaskStatus') and VALUE ='Failed'"
df = apl_model.get_summary().filter(my_filter).select('OID').collect()
failed_segments = df['OID'].tolist()
print('Preview of failed segments')
print(failed_segments[:5])

 

The log contains the cause of failure:

df = apl_model.get_fit_operation_log().filter("LEVEL = 0").select('OID','ORIGIN','MESSAGE').head(5).collect()
df.columns = [col_segment, 'Cause', 'Error']
df.style.hide(axis='index')

 

 

 

These sports were introduced after 1970. Thus, there is no reference data to compare against.

To obtain the Data Drift report, you must provide a segment value as in the example below:

seg_value = "Swimming"
apl_model.build_report(segment_name=seg_value)
apl_model.generate_notebook_iframe_report()
#apl_model.generate_html_report('Sport_Report')

 

We are nearing the end of this post, and you have not yet seen how to run a comparison with the SQL interface. Here is the syntax for calling the new APL function COMPARE_DATA from a SQL script:

drop view DATASET_1;
create view DATASET_1 as (
 select "Height", "Weight", "Age", "Medal", "Gender", "Season", "Country", "Sport"
 from "APL_SAMPLES"."OLYMPICS" 
 where "Year" <= 1970  
 order by "Sport", "Id"
);

drop view DATASET_2;
create view DATASET_2 as (
 select "Height", "Weight", "Age", "Medal", "Gender", "Season", "Country", "Sport"
 from "APL_SAMPLES"."OLYMPICS" 
 where "Year" > 1970  
 order by "Sport", "Id"
);

DO BEGIN
    declare header "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.FUNCTION_HEADER";
    declare config "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.OPERATION_CONFIG_EXTENDED";   
    declare var_desc "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.VARIABLE_DESC_OID";      
    declare var_role "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.VARIABLE_ROLES_WITH_COMPOSITES_OID";      
    declare out_log   "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.OPERATION_LOG";             
    declare out_summary  "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.SUMMARY";   
    declare out_metric   "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.DEBRIEF_METRIC_OID";      
    declare out_property "SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::BASE.T.DEBRIEF_PROPERTY_OID";
 
    :header.insert(('Oid', 'Before-After 1970'));

    :config.insert(('APL/SegmentColumnName', 'Sport',null)); 

	:var_desc.insert((0,'Height','number','continuous',0,0,null,null,null,null));
	:var_desc.insert((1,'Weight','number','continuous',0,0,null,null,null,null));
	:var_desc.insert((2,'Age','integer','continuous',0,0,null,null,null,null));
    :var_desc.insert((3,'Medal','string','nominal',0,0,null,null,null,null));
	:var_desc.insert((4,'Gender','string','nominal',0,0,null,null,null,null));
	:var_desc.insert((5,'Season','string','nominal',0,0,null,null,null,null));
	:var_desc.insert((6,'Country','string','nominal',0,0,null,null,null,null));
	
	"SAP_PA_APL"."sap.pa.apl.base::COMPARE_DATA" (
	:header, :config, :var_desc, :var_role,'USER_APL','DATASET_1', 'USER_APL','DATASET_2', 
	out_log, out_summary, out_metric, out_property );
 
 	select value as "Status", count(*) as "Nb of Segments" from :out_summary where key = 'AplTaskStatus' group by value;
	select OID as "Sport", message as "Error" from :out_log where level=0;
	 	
    select * from SAP_PA_APL."sap.pa.apl.debrief.report::Deviation_ByVariable"(:out_property,:out_metric, Deviation_Threshold => 0.9);
    select * from SAP_PA_APL."sap.pa.apl.debrief.report::Deviation_ByCategory"(:out_property,:out_metric, Deviation_Threshold => 0.9); 
    select * from SAP_PA_APL."sap.pa.apl.debrief.report::Deviation_CategoryFrequencies"(:out_property,:out_metric) order by "Abs % Change" desc;
END;

-- Cases where a comparison is not possible
select "Sport" from "DATASET_1" minus select "Sport" from "DATASET_2"; -- Sports that have been removed 
select "Sport" from "DATASET_2" minus select "Sport" from "DATASET_1"; -- New Sports

 

The APL drift detector supports also a 2-step approach to address the cases where you have a changing dataset that needs to be compared on a regular basis (e.g. every week or every month) to a fixed reference. The samples below illustrate how it works with Python:

Data Drift Step 1 notebook   Data Drift Step 2 notebook 

and with SQL:

Data Drift Step 1 script   Data Drift Step 2 script 

 

Happy data drift detection with APL.

To know more about APL

entry.title: Accelerate Your AI and Innovation Journey with Expert-Guided Services from SAP
entry.content:
At SAP, we are committed to helping our customers innovate and adopt technologies quickly, effectively, and with confidence. As part of this mission, we‚Äôre excited to share a series of expert-guided services and enablement opportunities offered through the Foundational success plan designed to help you unlock the power of SAP BTP including AI, SAP Build, and SAP HANA Cloud solutions.

These offerings of Expert Guided Implementation workshops (EGI) from SAP Enterprise Support are tailored to provide hands-on support and guided experiences, helping you get started with the latest innovations while minimizing complexity and accelerating time-to-value.

Whether you're looking to innovate and improve business processes through process automations, harness the power of AI to accelerate innovations, this series has something for everyone.

The following EGI sessions will run throughout the year with quarterly updates to the schedule.

Available Services at a Glance

Topic

Service Name

Description

Vector Engine, Knowledge Graph and Generative AI

SAP HANA Cloud Multiple Model Programming using Vector Engine and Retrieval Augmented Generation

Multi-day service to help customers activate and explore the Vector Engine and Knowledge Graph in SAP HANA Cloud, enabling large language model (LLM) integration and generative AI scenarios. Currently in pilot through the SAP ESAC program.

Joule

Support to Activate Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition

2-day service to empower customers on how to fulfil the prerequisites to activate Joule to be used with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (PCE).

Development using Build Code and Joule

Pro-code Cloud Application Programming Development using SAP Build and AI (Joule)

Multi-day service to empower customers with the knowledge of CAP Development in SAP HANA Cloud. After the service, customers will know of CAP development and design in SAP HANA Cloud utilizing the SAP Business Application Studio and SAP Build Code with Joule.

Application Development

Low-code/no-code application development through SAP Build

Multi-day service to help customers adopt SAP Build Apps for low-code/no-code development, including hands-on support and best practice guidance.

Process Automation

Process Automation through SAP Build

Multi-day guidance designed to help customers get started with SAP Build Process Automation, including hands-on support and best practice guidance.

Administration, Monitoring topics for SAP HANA Cloud

Configuration, Administration, Security and Monitoring topics for SAP HANA Cloud

Help customers with SAP HANA Cloud capabilities, key features available and admin tools for database Monitoring.

Modeling in SAP HANA Cloud

SAP HANA Cloud Modeling

Empower customers with the knowledge of Modeling in SAP HANA Cloud.

 What to expect from these services

All services are delivered by SAP experts and follow a structured, guided approach that includes:

  • Overview of the solution capabilities
  • Step-by-step technical guidance
  • Hands-on activities to accelerate learning and adoption
  • Best practices and tips for long-term success

These expert-guided services are ideal for customers looking to accelerate their transformation journey, whether you're exploring AI for the first time, expanding your use of SAP HANA Cloud, or adapting business processes with SAP Build.

How it works

  • Web session, 1-2 hours each morning where SAP expert explains the topic using training materials
  • Duration is from 2 to 5 days depending on the topic
  • Set daily schedule with pre-defined goals for each day
  • Available across different time zones and languages (topic dependent)
  • Afternoon 2-3 hours on the same day where you execute demonstrated steps within your own project, on your own SAP environment
  • During that time, you have direct access to the SAP expert delivering the workshop for guidance and support
  • Registration closes one week before the session date ‚Äì sign up early!

 If you are interested in participating in these expert-guided services or learning more, simply follow the links above to register for the service.

For customers if you have issues accessing the above links, there may be an authorizations issue. Please note a one-time registration in SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, is required for accessing the EGI service. A detailed step-by step guide to registration can be found here.

A list of the EGI services and all other SAP BTP assets, services and content for SAP Enterprise Support customers are available through the SAP Enterprise Support Value Map program.

As you continue to innovate with SAP, we are here to support you every step of the way. These services are designed to accelerate adoption, reduce complexity, and drive outcomes so you can make the most of your SAP investments at no additional cost.

Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to engage with SAP experts and take your next steps in AI, innovation, and automation. Let us help you fast-track your success!

Thanks and Regards,

Robert Kelly

BTP Lead Architect - SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Enabling Scalable Growth for Mid-Sized Companies
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud: Enabling Scalable Growth for Mid-Sized Companies


In highly competitive market, these days the impact of mid-sized companies is hard to miss; they‚Äôve learned to position themselves in a crowded market. To succeed, they stay quick, dream up fresh ideas, chase growth and yet still juggle limited money, shifting customer demands and rules from many regulation authorities. That is where SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud steps in - a strong, public-cloud answer that scales on command, speeds up innovation, offers enterprise-grade tools and cuts out most of the usual IT headaches.

Scaling Smart: Navigating Growth Challenges in the Mid-Market Sector

Mid-sized companies find themselves compressed between the big companies and the start-ups. Like the big players, they do not enjoy huge IT teams or expensive resources for year-long tech rollouts, yet their day-to-day headaches are just as trapped. Running operations in multiple countries, adjusting several product lines, keeping up with shifting rules, and pushing ahead with digital change all demand solid tools and budget. After all these conflicts, keeping companies balance sheet in shiny condition is not that easy. If they hang on to that aging ERP or a patchwork of outdated apps and systems, the drag can swallow momentum, showing up as:

  • Extra stress in meeting tough compliance standards
  • Focus shift from priorities to non-priorities activities, hurdles that block entry into fresh markets or regions
  • Isolation that keep departments talking past each other
  • On-premises systems that pile up hidden total cost of ownership
  • Rigid procedures with little automation and avoiding changes which will keep away from latest and cost-effective solution.

 What is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud product is all about?

With pre-configured best practices, SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is a scalable, cloud-based ERP solution that optimises business operations. Through the Central Business Configuration tool, it facilitates industry-specific configurations, minimal customisation, and quick deployment.

Continuous innovation, real-time insights, and sustainability tracking are made possible by its integrated AI, machine learning, and tools such as Signavio and SAP Analytics Cloud. Flexibility and compatibility are guaranteed by a smooth integration with both SAP and non-SAP systems.

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is a future-ready ERP platform that offers agility, innovation, and sustainability, making it the perfect choice for organisations looking to modernise. Below are the key features of SAP Public cloud,

Now, let‚Äôs see how all mentioned features can drive scalable growth for small and mid-sized companies.

 

1. Total cost of owner ship & Cost Effectiveness

Consider infrastructure upgrades, continuous system maintenance, specialised IT support, and those annoying manual updates. Traditional ERP systems can have some unforeseen costs. SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, on the other hand, adopts a different strategy with its subscription-based model, allowing you to benefit from predictable operational expenses and a significantly reduced total cost of ownership (TCO).

Here are a few benefits:

  • You avoid the headache of project-based upgrades and receive constant innovations and updates.
  • No requirement for sizable IT staffs or substantial physical infrastructure
  • Backups, disaster recovery, and cybersecurity are all integrated into SAP's secure data centres.

Mid-sized businesses can now more easily access and afford enterprise-grade ERP capabilities thanks to this model. By using SAP public cloud, companies can save around 50% of implementation cost.

 

2. Accelerated ROI through faster deployment and adoption

Businesses can quickly and efficiently implement SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud thanks to the SAP Activate methodology and SAP ALM. Implementation time is greatly reduced, frequently going live in 12 to 16 weeks (For less complex business), thanks to predefined business processes, guided configuration tools, and automated testing.

This type of flexibility enables mid-sized businesses to:

  • Avoid long project cycles
  • Reduce the cost of implementation
  • Reallocate internal resources to strategic business objectives.
  • See a return on investment almost immediately. Additionally, SAP provides pre-configured industry content (such as for professional services, manufacturing, and wholesale distribution), which enables businesses to more quickly align with the demands of their particular sector.

I have seen often small and mid-size industries facing lot of challenges with resources and budget, SAP Public cloud solution can be real game changer for these companies. By using SAP public cloud companies can save around 60% of their time.

3. Public cloud package ‚Äì

As per my experience, it will be always beneficial to business if they consider SAP cloud ERP as a package. It often includes ALM (Application lifecycle management), BTP (Business technology platform) and other services.

Advantages of the packages,

  • Pay as you go model
  • Cost effective
  • Bundled value
  • Quick time to value
  • Innovation Ready
  • For few products no separate licencing is required

4. Continuous Innovation, Delivered Quarterly

Thanks to automatic quarterly updates, SAP keeps your experience fresh and evolving bringing you new features, smarter tools, and meaningful enhancements like:

  • Keeping pace with changes in national laws and regulations
  • Refining processes and boosting overall performance
  • Enhancing intelligence and user experience through AI and machine learning

In todays competitive market business should focus on their priorities, it will be very dangerous for business to involved in unproductive or less productive area, especially it can be big hurdle for mid-size companies.

With Public cloud business can be competitive and flexible with enjoying access to newest product features available to them without any extra efforts on expansive upgrades and dip pre-launch testing. SAP will take care of all upgrade process on the behalf of companies so there will be very less chance of errors and failures.

5. Flexible, Future-Proof Scalability

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is thoughtfully built to grow with your business ‚Äî scaling effortlessly in every direction.

  • Companies can improve their systems by adding new functionalities as their needs evolve over a period of time, such as Integrated Order-to-Cash and Procure-to-Pay, Advanced Financial Planning & Analysis or subscription billing and real time data.
  • On other side once business expectation fulfilled they can use the same global template to expand into new business units, regions, or subsidiaries.

Since it‚Äôs built for the cloud from the ground up, businesses can easily scale without pouring money into new hardware. That makes it perfect for companies planning to grow internationally or handle mergers and acquisitions. Even mid-sized firms can tap into the public cloud to reach their goals faster and more affordably.

6. Built-in intelligent technology solutions

SAP S/4HANA Intelligent technologies that improve decision-making, simplify daily tasks, and optimise business processes abound in the public cloud:

Even with smaller teams, these features enable mid-sized businesses to function more effectively working smarter, not harder. To be more precise, business can also take advantages of Joule for reporting or taking accurate data from system is fraction of second.

7. Global Compliance with Local Precision

Localisations for more than 40 countries are pre-installed in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and include:

  • Handling all necessary documentation and compliance filings as per local requirements.
  • Meeting country-specific tax and legal obligations, including e-invoicing, GST, and VAT.
  •  Providing financial reporting structures and customized charts of accounts suited to local standards.

With all specific local features business can enter in the market with confidence as SAP has already taken all the headache and incorporated all region-specific issues in advanced in the SAP product, so business can concentrate on other important aspect which is important for business growth.

8. Collaborative Framework for Functional Integration

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud eliminates data silos and produces a unified picture of the company by integrating finance, supply chain, procurement, HR, and sales onto a single platform. Integrated analytics and dashboards provide decision-makers with real-time insights, such as:

  • Analysis of profitability by product, region, or customer
  • Current stock levels in every warehouse
  • Different pre-defined KPIs

Better decision-making, faster reactions, and more strategic growth planning are made possible by this instant visibility.

Summary:  Impact on mid-size businesses

SAP S/4HANA is a game-changer for mid-sized businesses, acting as a powerful catalyst for growth and innovation that goes well beyond just being a cloud-based ERP. The goal of SAP cloud ERP is to transition all mid-sized businesses to the cloud, allowing them to experience significant improvements by leveraging all the features and technologies available for their growth.

In summary, considering all these points, we can confidently say that SAP cloud ERP is a key driver of success. It supports businesses in various ways, including strategy, value, cost management, innovation, and fostering genuine growth.

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud isn‚Äôt just a tool for businesses aiming to expand without the usual headaches; it‚Äôs a true partner in growth. With SAP S/4HANA Cloud, customers can expect to see a 50% reduction in IT staff compared to traditional ERP systems.


Source - #https://www.sap.com/products/erp/s4hana.html
Note - Few points are refer from AI, also Image is AI generated.

entry.title: Uploading ZIP/CSV Files as BLOBs in SAP HANA HDI Containers ‚Äì The Missing Guide
entry.content:
Use Case:

I had to load a static ZIP file into an HDI container table for downstream processing. These ZIP files contain industry best practices that are consumed by a downstream system to apply standardized configurations. The challenge? Getting those ZIPs into the HDI container in a way that works with .hdbtabledata.

Challenge:

This seemingly simple requirement comes with some surprising limitations:

  • You can't upload ZIPs via SAP HANA Database Explorer directly.
  • You can't use `.hdbtabledata` for raw BLOBs without transformation.
  • HDI containers don‚Äôt expose a "file system" where you can drop files for SQL access.

Our Approach

We developed an automated, script-based approach:

  1. A shell script to convert ZIP files into Base64 strings.

  2. A CSV file that holds metadata like ID, NAME, SKU_ID, and the encoded ZIP content.

  3. A .hdbtabledata configuration to decode Base64 into binary and store it in a BLOB column.

Why Convert ZIP to Base64 in This Case?

The .hdbtabledata mechanism used for importing data into HDI containers expects text-based formats like CSV. However:

  • ZIP files are binary and contain null bytes or special characters that break CSV formatting.

  • Base64 encoding transforms binary content into a safe, ASCII string, suitable for CSV and text-based tools.

  • Later, we decode the Base64 string during the HDI import to restore the original ZIP binary into a BLOB column.

Table Definition

CREATE COLUMN TABLE "MY_CONTAINER"."ZIP_STORE" (
    "ID" NVARCHAR(50),
    "NAME" NVARCHAR(255),
    "FILE" BLOB,
    "SKU_ID" NVARCHAR(50)
);

 

Metadata

IDNAMESKU_IDZIP_FILE
b504b47a-50b6-4a16-8e5b-471cc88b6a6aBASE_TEMPLATE_80078838007883ZIP_BP_20250609.zip
99ded8ca-c59f-4103-b933-9049e9568185BEST_PRACTICE_80078858007885ZIP_BP_20250609.zip

Shell Script

#!/bin/bash

# Input: list of entries (ID, logical NAME, SKU_ID, ZIP_FILE)
INPUT_LIST="file_list.csv"

# Output: final CSV for .hdbtabledata
OUTPUT_CSV="BASE_TEMPLATE_DATA.csv"

# Start output CSV with header
echo "ID,NAME,FILE,SKU_ID" > "$OUTPUT_CSV"

# Loop through file list
tail -n +2 "$INPUT_LIST" | while IFS=',' read -r ID NAME SKU_ID ZIP_FILE; do
  ID=$(echo "$ID" | tr -d '\r')
  NAME=$(echo "$NAME" | tr -d '\r')
  SKU_ID=$(echo "$SKU_ID" | tr -d '\r')
  ZIP_FILE=$(echo "$ZIP_FILE" | tr -d '\r')
  # Check file exists
  if [[ ! -f "$ZIP_FILE" ]]; then
      echo "File not found: $ZIP_FILE"
      exit 1
  fi
  # Encode zip file
  BASE64_CONTENT=$(base64 < "$ZIP_FILE" | tr -d '\n')
  echo "$ID,$NAME,\"$BASE64_CONTENT\",$SKU_ID" >> "$OUTPUT_CSV"
done
echo "Final CSV created: $OUTPUT_CSV"

 

Output CSV

IDNAMEFILESKU_ID
b504b47a-50b6-4a16-8e5b-471cc88b6a6aBASE_TEMPLATE_8007883UEsDBBQACAgIAJ1oiFoAAAAAAAAA......8007883
99ded8ca-c59f-4103-b933-9049e9568185BEST_PRACTICE_8007885UEsDBBQACAgIAJ1oiFoAAAAAAAAA......8007885


Final Step

Now that we have the Base64-encoded CSV ready, we need to update .hdbtabledata to decode the FILE column back to binary.

Why This Is Required

We converted ZIPs to Base64, but HANA expects raw binary in the BLOB column. The decodeBase64 function tells the HDI importer to convert Base64 back to binary before inserting into the table.

What This Does

"FILE": {
  "name": "decodeBase64",
  "type": "function",
  "parameters": {
    "column_name": "FILE"
  }
}

In .hdbtabledata, this configuration says:

  • "name": "decodeBase64" ‚Äì tells SAP to decode the Base64 string.

  • "type": "function" ‚Äì uses built-in transformation, not static mapping.

  • "column_name": "FILE" ‚Äì applies decoding only to this column.

 

Final .hdbtabledata File

{
  "format_version": 1,
  "imports": [
    {
      "target_table": "BASE_TEMPLATE",
      "source_data": {
        "data_type": "CSV",
        "file_name": "BASE_TEMPLATE_DATA.csv",
        "has_header": true,
        "type_config": {
          "delimiter": ","
        }
      },
      "import_settings": {
        "import_columns": [
          "ID",
          "NAME",
          "FILE",
          "SKU_ID"
        ],
        "include_filter": []
      },
      "column_mappings": {
        "ID": "ID",
        "NAME": "NAME",
        "FILE": {
          "name": "decodeBase64",
          "type": "function",
          "parameters": {
            "column_name": "FILE"
          }
        },
        "SKU_ID": "SKU_ID"
      }
    }
  ]
}

 

Conclusion

This approach provides a clean and reproducible way to store binary ZIP content inside SAP HANA HDI containers using only CSV and shell scripting ‚Äî no manual intervention or external file handling required at import time.

By converting binary ZIPs to Base64 and decoding them during the .hdbtabledata import, we work around the limitation of HDI containers not supporting direct file system access or native binary uploads.

This method is especially useful when:

  • You want to automate bulk loading of template ZIPs or configuration files.

  • You‚Äôre building dev/test environments and want reproducible data setups.

  • You need to version and transport BLOB content as part of your HDI artifacts.

Hopefully, this saves you the hours I spent figuring it out. If you face additional challenges or optimize this further ‚Äî feel free to share back!

Happy to answer questions or collaborate if you‚Äôre doing something similar.

entry.title: Session 5 Recap & Highlights - Planning Your Transition Paths to SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Let's review the key insights from our session on 'Planning your transition path to SAP Business Data Cloud'.

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) marks a transformative approach to enterprise data management and utilization. This comprehensive SaaS platform centralizes and governs SAP data assets while integrating effortlessly with external data sources. BDC is designed to tackle the increasing complexity of today's data environments and meet the critical demand for AI-enabled, real-time analytical capabilities.

 

Customer Needs Driving the Transition

Organizations face several critical challenges that SAP BDC is designed to address:
Data Accessibility and Context: Companies struggle with extracting data from SAP systems while maintaining business semantics and context. When data is moved to external platforms, valuable business meaning is often lost, requiring significant time and resources to rebuild .

AI and Analytics Acceleration: Modern businesses need high-quality, AI-ready data to drive reliable and accurate artificial intelligence applications. The traditional approach of fragmented data silos impedes innovation and limits the potential for advanced analytics .

Simplified Data Landscape: Multiple tools, manual processes, and inconsistent data preparation tasks slow the development of advanced analytics and AI capabilities. Organizations seek a unified platform that can eliminate these inefficiencies.

Real-time Insights: The demand for faster time-to-insights requires modern infrastructure capable of supporting real-time decision-making processes across all business functions.

 

Adoption Journey and Transition Approaches
SAP has defined a structured approach to BDC adoption that allows organizations to progress at their own pace while preserving existing investments. The transition follows a three-phase methodology: Lift, Shift, and Innovate.

 

Evolving Beyond SAP Data and Analytics Portfolio

SAP customers utilizing systems like SAP BW (Business Warehouse), SAP HANA, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud are increasingly seeking pathways to modernize their data environments. The introduction of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) represents a major shift, offering organizations an integrated, cloud-native platform capable of unifying data from SAP and non-SAP sources, enabling advanced analytics, and powering AI-driven insights in real time.

Migrating from SAP BW and SAP HANA
Many enterprises have long relied on SAP BW for critical reporting and data warehousing needs. However, with SAP BW 7.5 reaching end of mainstream maintenance in 2027, businesses are tasked with deciding between maintaining aging systems or embracing cloud-ready solutions. BDC allows organizations to lift and shift their existing BW environments‚Äîincluding critical data models and business logic‚Äîdirectly into the cloud, often through SAP BW/4HANA private cloud edition. This preserves past investments while immediately unlocking scalable data products, improved governance, and seamless integration with SAP Datasphere and Databricks for analytics and AI scenarios. SAP HANA customers similarly benefit from BDC‚Äôs cloud-native architecture, which supports both structured and unstructured data, and offers scalable compute and flexible storage options for modern workloads.
 

 

Transitioning from SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud
With SAP BDC, customers currently operating SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud can expect a smooth, phased transition. BDC unifies these solutions into a single environment, streamlining workflows and reducing silos. Organizations leverage their existing data pipelines and analytics use cases - with features like zero-copy integration and data product generators - while quickly gaining access to enhanced AI, collaboration tools, and cross-platform interoperability. This means existing assets and semantic models in SAP Datasphere or Analytics Cloud can be retained and enriched rather than rebuilt, simplifying governance and accelerating time to value.
 
 
Key Benefits and Approach
The move to SAP Business Data Cloud is designed to minimize disruption. SAP provides a structured, stepwise migration methodology focused on:
  • Data Continuity: Preserving historical data and business rule integrity.
  • Operational Stability: Supporting parallel operations and robust fallback options during migration.
  • Capability Development: Offering training and resources so teams can maximize the value of BDC features.
  • Unified Data Governance: Centralizing oversight and compliance across all SAP and external data sources.

 

Strategic Planning Resources

It provides clear, concise answers to the most common technical and strategic questions architects encounter, such as how BDC unifies and governs SAP and third-party data, supports semantic modeling, and aligns with existing SAP environments like SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP BW.

It provides a centralized platform where architects can explore missions, reference architectures, and best practice guides tailored to the unique challenges of data platform modernization. Through curated use cases and real-world implementation patterns, the Discovery Center clarifies how SAP BDC unifies SAP and non-SAP data, streamlines data integration, and supports advanced analytics and AI. Architects can leverage solution diagrams, architecture blueprints, and tools in the Discovery Center to design resilient, scalable BDC environments.

The SAP Architecture Centre is a strategic hub for enterprise architects navigating the transition to SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). It offers in-depth reference architectures, solution diagrams, and best practice guides specifically designed to address the complex requirements of modern data management and cloud adoption.

 

Implementation Support

The Accelerator Hub offers immediate access to an extensive library of ready-to-use integration components, APIs, and architectural templates that simplify the creation and deployment of cloud data solutions designed for SAP's dynamic platform ecosystem. This centralized resource enables architects to rapidly identify, assess, and test APIs along with Data Product and Data Package elements specifically for S/4HANA Private Cloud environments, significantly reducing the challenges commonly encountered during cloud migration and hybrid integration projects.
 

 

The SAP Roadmap Explorer is a powerful tool that helps enterprise architects plan their transition to SAP Business Data Cloud with greater clarity and confidence. It provides a clear view of current features and future innovations related to BDC, allowing architects to understand what‚Äôs available now and what‚Äôs coming soon. This helps them align technical plans with business goals and make informed decisions about timing, dependencies, and integration points. Overall, the SAP Roadmap Explorer gives architects the insight they need to design a well-structured, future-ready path to SAP Business Data Cloud.

 

Technology Capability Model in LeanIX

 

LeanIX‚Äôs Technology Capability Model (TCM) provides a framework for:
  • Current state assessment of existing technology landscapes
  • Target architecture design for future state planning
  • Transformation roadmap development with clear milestones and dependencies
  • Governance structure establishment for implementation oversight

 

Next Steps and Way Forward
Immediate Actions
1. Assess current SAP BW environment using SAP‚Äôs free assessment service (SAP Migration Assessment)
2. Evaluate transition readiness through the BDC Discovery Workshop
3. Develop stakeholder alignment across business and IT teams
Medium-term Planning
1. Design target architecture using LeanIX and SAP Architecture Center resources
2. Create detailed migration roadmap with phased approach
3. Establish governance framework for ongoing transformation management
Long-term Vision
1. Implement AI/ML capabilities through Databricks integration
2. Adopt Intelligent Applications for accelerated business value
3. Optimize data product economy for reusable, scalable data assets

The transition to SAP Business Data Cloud represents more than a technical migration - it‚Äôs a strategic transformation that positions organizations for the AI-driven future of business. With SAP‚Äôs structured approach of Land, Expand, and Adopt, organizations can preserve existing investments while gaining access to cutting-edge capabilities. The comprehensive ecosystem of resources, tools, and professional services ensures that organizations have the support needed to navigate this critical transformation successfully.
With proper planning, stakeholder alignment, and strategic execution, the move to SAP Business Data Cloud can unlock significant business value and competitive advantage in an increasingly data-driven marketplace.
 

Note: Slides from the session and the recording would be only available to the registered attendees. So if you have not registered, please register now using the link - Architecting Your SAP Business Data Cloud Journey ‚Äì From Data to Intelligence!

 

Special thanks to...

@PaulKurchina  @Timo  @Gaurish-Dessai  @ralph_richter  @NaveenDumpa

  3. Purchase Pilot - Áï∞Â∏∏Ê§úÁü•Ê©üËÉΩ„ÅÆÂÆüÊºî

„Åì„ÅÆ„ÇΩ„É™„É•„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Å´„Çà„Çä„ÄÅÂÖ•ÂäõÊôÇÈñì„ÅÆÂâäÊ∏õ „ÇÑ ÂÖ•Âäõ„Éü„Çπ„ÅÆËªΩÊ∏õ „ÇíÂÆüÁèæ„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„ÅôÔºÅ„Åæ„Åü„ÄÅÁï∞Â∏∏„Çí„É™„Ç¢„É´„Çø„Ç§„É†Ê§úÁü•„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Åß„ÄÅÊâãÊàª„Çä„Åå„Çº„É≠ „Å´„Å™„Çä„ÄÅ„ÇØ„É™„Éº„É≥„Å™„Éá„Éº„Çø„Å´„Çà„ÇãÁµåÂñ∂ÊåáÊ®ô„ÇíÈ´òÈÄüÊõ¥Êñ∞„Å´Áπã„Åå„Çä„Åæ„ÅôÔºÅ

 

„Åæ„Å®„ÇÅ

  • SAP „Ç∏„É£„Éë„É≥ „ÉÅ„Éº„É† TO BEs „ÅÆÊåëÊà¶: Á§æÂì°Ë¶ñÁÇπ„Åß ‚ÄúÁèæÂ†¥ DX‚Äù „Çí„ÉÜ„Éº„Éû„Å´„ÄÅAI √ó BTP „ÅÆÂèØËÉΩÊÄß„ÇíÊ§úË®º
